7f0ef20a-663e-4030-b22a-fa2df7a22173.description: All new leaders at CHRISTUS Health are enrolled in Leader Foundations, a 6-month program designed to provide the foundational knowledge and skills necessary to be a successful leader in the organization. Leaders learn not only the operational aspects of their leadership position but also strengthen their skills in retaining and engaging Associates. The entire program is built on the foundation of the mission, vision, and values of CHRISTUS Health.
7f0ef20a-663e-4030-b22a-fa2df7a22173.name: Leader Foundations

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and participation in three in-person sessions (5 days total).
Completion of HR Fundamentals (1/2 day in-person training).
Completion of Software Day (1/2 day in-person training).
Completion of Introduction to Technology Webinar.
Participation in two group coaching sessions.
Completion of two mission-in-action projects.

c4a13577-0da5-40d2-a4a5-ed2805997ae2.description: The Emerging Leader program at CHRISTUS Health is designed for Associates who desire to be future leaders in the organization. This 3-month program provides participants with an opportunity to learn critical leadership skills, to interview current leaders, and to gain insight about their leadership strengths and growth opportunities.
c4a13577-0da5-40d2-a4a5-ed2805997ae2.name: Emerging Leader

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and participation in 3 live webinars
Completion of 8 LinkedIn Learning and other e-learning courses
Completion of the DiSC Workplace assessment
Completion of a personalized Leadership Development Plan
Interview with a current leader and submission of an interview summary

e671f42e-962e-4a74-9f23-b7b9bbc863b8.description: CHRISTUS Health Six Sigma Yellow Belt earners have foundational knowledge of the Lean Six Sigma problem-solving process and use fundamental tools and methods to analyze and solve quality problems. Yellow Belts are involved with Lean or other quality improvement projects.
e671f42e-962e-4a74-9f23-b7b9bbc863b8.name: IM University Training - Six Sigma Yellow Belt Professional

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and completion of the Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt course and workshop.
Individually or in a workshop team, apply the LSS Yellow concepts and tools to analyze a problem in either the learner's business unit or relative to their team.

717168e9-7ef6-4e2c-bcf3-7273c0b1bec3.description: It is critical that leaders in Catholic health care develop the skills needed to carry on the distinctive identity and mission of CHRISTUS Health. One way to do this is by focusing on ‘Community Building’, one of the Servant Leadership characteristics. ‘Community Building’ emphasizes enhancing the culture of belonging and well-being in the ministry by providing both content and an activity designed to assist in its integration into the everyday life of the CHRISTUS Health.
717168e9-7ef6-4e2c-bcf3-7273c0b1bec3.name: Community Building - Executive Formation Program

badge_template_activities.title: Be an executive leader at CHRISTUS Health
Complete a review of all ‘Community Building’ materials and resources
Implement a ‘Community Building’ initiative
Report on impact of designated initiative
Achieve measurable outcomes on Associate Engagement scores

c0c76239-65a1-4bae-bcb6-699b0474ac06.description: Earners of the IM University Training - Six Sigma Green Belt Professional Certification badge by CHRISTUS Health are able to analyze and solve quality problems and are involved with Six Sigma, Lean or other quality improvement projects. Earners of this badge also understand Lean Methodology as well as the phases of D-M-A-I-C. Individuals who have completed this IM University course are now qualified to take the Six Sigma Green Belt Certification Exam.
c0c76239-65a1-4bae-bcb6-699b0474ac06.name: IM University Training - Six Sigma Green Belt Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Completed SkillSoft IM University Certification Preparation Curriculum
Work with management to identify and complete a performance improvement project
Participate in weekly collaborative study sessions and labs

52617e10-95cc-4bf9-a125-3993fb81c8ae.description: Nominated by their CEO, a CHRISTUS Leadership and Ethics Academy (LEA) earner masters the charter of the CHRISTUS Health mission, vision, and core values. This one-year program prepares participants executive healthcare leadership by guiding them to: *Develop increased self-awareness to enhance leadership style; *Become more effective at executing the strategy of the system; and *Engage and motivate Associates to maximize results.
52617e10-95cc-4bf9-a125-3993fb81c8ae.name: Leadership and Ethics Academy

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and participation in five in-person intensive workshops (10 days total)
Attendance and participation in monthly virtual learning opportunities.
Completion of 15 hours of one-on-one executive coaching.
Completion of a 360 assessment with feedback from supervisor, peers, and direct reports.
Development and accomplishment of goals identified on an individualized Leadership Development Plan.
Completion of a cross-functional challenge project to address an organizational need.
Study of the book "What Got You Here Won’t Get You There" by Marshall Goldsmith.

370e16c1-d77f-4e16-acdb-2d3ddd91b6fa.description: Earners of the IM University Training - BA Requirements Professional badge by CHRISTUS Health have developed the skills necessary to engage and elicit information from business and technical users to develop and document requirements. They are trained in techniques and processes according to the BABOK. Earners of this badge are competent in-depth analysis to verify and validate business objectives, rules, and outcomes.
370e16c1-d77f-4e16-acdb-2d3ddd91b6fa.name: IM University Training - BA Requirements Professional

badge_template_activities.title: Write and develop project deliverables of: Business Case, Business Requirements, Communication Plan and Resource Plan
All participates demonstrate interviewing, and information gathering techniques

1bc6a5c0-57a0-4f48-95e1-9e49ccc706e8.description: Internship program graduates are world-class Associates who have completed an internship at CHRISTUS Health and used innovation to develop real-world projects that positively impact the organization. These individuals dedicate time on new products or services, while learning about compassion, empathy and high-quality care. They apply these experiences to help promote individual growth in their career path, as well as better support the company in extending the healing ministry of Jesus Christ.
1bc6a5c0-57a0-4f48-95e1-9e49ccc706e8.name: CHRISTUS Health Internship Program

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in a CHRISTUS Health Summer Internship Program.
Complete all activities included in the Learning and Development Plan, including assigned project.
Attend the Decker “Communicate to Influence” Program.
Attend the Everything DISC program.
Conduct final presentation to Executives.

a45371d8-90c8-4895-b1ed-f367b03846f4.description: CHRISTUS Health Business Process Workflow professional earners exhibits the processes of an enterprise to analyze and improve the current process. The Business Process Workflow provides expertise in the modeling discipline when engaged with subject matter experts, who have specialized knowledge of the processes being modeled.
a45371d8-90c8-4895-b1ed-f367b03846f4.name: IM University Training - BA Business Process Workflows

badge_template_activities.title: Complete course assignments to demonstrate competency in organizational structures, operational processes and policies and workflows.

b016e421-aa26-46ef-b89c-c9b7c3bf9021.description: CHRISTUS Health Problem Management earners manage the lifecycle of all problems using the fundamental tools to classify, analyze the root cause, and implement problem resolutions.
b016e421-aa26-46ef-b89c-c9b7c3bf9021.name: IM University Training - BA Problem Management

badge_template_activities.title: Complete course assignments.

e009a2d3-6078-4109-b66f-6ee26c393b72.description: CHRISTUS Health Certified Talent Innovator earners are future thinking individuals that have attended an innovation lab and collaborated to solve a business need. They are able to build an intellectually diverse team to spark creativity and can establish the psychological and physical conditions that foster fresh thinking in their team. They apply powerful tactics for brainstorming ideas for new products, services, and processes that will advance our digital workforce readiness.
e009a2d3-6078-4109-b66f-6ee26c393b72.name: CHRISTUS Health Talent Innovator

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in a CHRISTUS Health Talent Innovation lab.

CHRISTUS Health Talent Innovation labs are followed up with tiger team meetings to continue the collaboration and innovation towards the business need. Innovation lab attendees are required to remain focused on the business solution needs for up to 90 days.

3c56f47c-d747-4229-bd1f-344fe9cad509.description: Earners of the IM University Training - BA Test Management Professional badge by CHRISTUS Health have developed skills in integrating and end-user testing. Individuals who have completed this course are now able to document, track and provide test validations.
3c56f47c-d747-4229-bd1f-344fe9cad509.name: IM University Training - BA Test Management Professional

badge_template_activities.title: Complete course assignments
Complete and pass administered exam

e1a35d6b-7267-47bf-bdb6-7b0b9706a37a.description: Earners of the IM University Training - Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) Professional badge by CHRISTUS Health exhibit general awareness of the key elements, concepts, and terminology used in the ITIL service lifecycle, including the links between lifecycle stages, the processes used and their contribution to service management practices. Individuals who have completed this IM University course are now qualified to take the ITIL Certification Exam.
e1a35d6b-7267-47bf-bdb6-7b0b9706a37a.name: IM University Training - Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) Professional

badge_template_activities.title: Complete an ITIL Foundation training course and associated lab activities or self-study training

fe32517d-61ae-4b5f-bedf-7060913983c4.description: Participants in the one-year Physician Leadership Development Program are nominated by clinical executive leadership to prepare for future senior leadership roles at CHRISTUS Health. The program guides leaders to develop a more profound understanding of CHRISTUS’ mission, vision, and values; develop increased self-awareness to enhance leadership styles; become more effective at executing the strategy of the system; and gain the skills to engage and motivate teams for maximum results.
fe32517d-61ae-4b5f-bedf-7060913983c4.name: Physician Leadership Development Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and participation in two in-person workshops
Attendance and participation in monthly virtual learning opportunities
Completion of 15 hours of executive coaching
Completion of a 360 assessment with feedback from supervisor, peers, and direct reports

69a2b781-9532-4f41-a0c3-670ea53448bf.description: In Spring 2020, CHRISTUS Health’s Learning & Development team competed in the first-ever Hackathon. This event focused on innovating Talent programs to be sustainable for the future and serve as powerful learning opportunities for the organization’s Associates. Your participation in the process resulted in an innovative new design that will reshape how we impact CHRISTUS Health Associates! Thank you for sharing your creativity, expertise, and passion for learning.
69a2b781-9532-4f41-a0c3-670ea53448bf.name: Hackathon Project Innovator

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully prepare and present a program proposal
Serve as lead or co-lead of one of the project teams selected
Attend Rounds 1 and 2 of the Hackathon proposals

9ec38558-6b7c-40a9-b002-ee0fa8bdef1d.description: In Spring 2020, CHRISTUS Health’s Learning & Development team competed in the first-ever Hackathon. This event focused on innovating Talent programs to be sustainable for the future and serve as powerful learning opportunities for the organization’s Associates. The proposals, ideas, and research brought forward were game-changing! Thank you for sharing your creativity, expertise, and passion for learning.
9ec38558-6b7c-40a9-b002-ee0fa8bdef1d.name: Hackathon Game Changer

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully prepare and present a program proposal
Participate on one of the project teams
Attend Rounds 1 and 2 of the Hackathon proposals

cc33a699-52f7-4e17-a676-be1cd3fb6b7b.description: In Spring 2020, CHRISTUS Health’s Learning & Development team competed in the first-ever Hackathon. This event focused on innovating Talent programs to be sustainable for the future and serve as powerful learning opportunities for the organization’s Associates. Your participation as a Shark for the team’s proposals was vital to identify our new program and process designs for the future! Thank you for sharing your time, insight, and commitment to the learning and development team.
cc33a699-52f7-4e17-a676-be1cd3fb6b7b.name: Hackathon Shark Judge

badge_template_activities.title: Attend Rounds 1 and 2 of the Hackathon proposals to engage with presenters, ask clarifying questions, and provide feedback
Participate in the deliberation process with other Sharks
Provide final feedback on designs after Round 2 of proposals

8d58cb62-c118-423e-8f2e-014962eeb0e9.description: The Patient/Customer Focus Committee was formed to place focus on the Talent Technology & Creative Solutions team and the direct impact they have on patients and customers within the company. As strategists of the committee, the group developed educational materials to shed light on customer connection, as well as created Associate collaboration recognition events. The team met regularly, researched user groups, developed projects, and contributed to improving overall team engagement.
8d58cb62-c118-423e-8f2e-014962eeb0e9.name: Patient/Customer Focus Committee Strategist

badge_template_activities.title: Be a member of the Talent Technology & Creative Solutions Team
Serve as a volunteer on the committee

79f37a77-56d2-4758-b950-61bf41b402c6.description: Our Enterprise Resource Project (ERP) is a system-wide way to make CHRISTUS Associates’ everyday tasks simpler, more efficient and located all in one place (a platform called Infor). By doing so, Associates can focus on delivering our mission and elevating quality patient care. Infor training sessions were hosted through a variety of methods that included instructor-led classrooms, live virtual webinars, and one-on-one virtual meetings.
79f37a77-56d2-4758-b950-61bf41b402c6.name: The Marathoner - 100+ ERP Trained Sessions

badge_template_activities.title: Host at least 100 Infor training sessions for CHRISTUS associates

5ac3f5e1-3cc3-4c1e-9df8-c881b0aea016.description: Our Enterprise Resource Project (ERP) is a system-wide way to make CHRISTUS Associates’ everyday tasks simpler, more efficient, and located all in one place (a platform called Infor). By doing so, Associates can focus on delivering our mission and elevating quality patient care. Infor training sessions were hosted through a variety of methods that included instructor-led classrooms, live virtual webinars, and one-on-one virtual meetings.
5ac3f5e1-3cc3-4c1e-9df8-c881b0aea016.name: Gold Level - 500+ Infor Trained Classes

badge_template_activities.title: Host 500+ Infor training sessions for CHRISTUS Associates.

c28f124a-9afc-4941-b187-b7be2be6c94f.description: Earners of the IM University Training - BA Communications Professional badge by CHRISTUS Health are able to engage in good communication and presentation skills, facilitate work meetings and ask good questions thanks to their participation in this course. Earners also have the ability to create clear and concise documentation.
c28f124a-9afc-4941-b187-b7be2be6c94f.name: IM University Training - BA Communications Professional

badge_template_activities.title: Complete course assignments to demonstrate, presentation, listening and writing skills

514a58b1-46c4-4f4b-b994-52fd675f5d54.description: The RISE CHRISTUS Mentorship Program is designed to develop and grow talent, working with CHRISTUS Health Associates to achieve their full potential using the knowledge, experience and competencies from a qualified mentor during the one-year program.
514a58b1-46c4-4f4b-b994-52fd675f5d54.name: RISE CHRISTUS Mentorship - Mentor

badge_template_activities.title: Meet with mentee a minimum of 8 individual meetings
Encourage mentee to complete quarterly Genesis Learning Assignments and attend group sessions: book review, lunch and learn & DiSC session
Utilize knowledge, experience and promotion of core competencies to help talent build on skills for future goals and milestones.
Provide insight and knowledge of the CHRISTUS Health organization.

392b3ce7-df3b-4817-ac98-c21e212cc976.description: The Nurse Leader Residency program at CHRISTUS Health develops diverse, multi-talented nursing leaders who lead engaged, high-performing teams. The 6-month program provides participants with an opportunity to develop critical leadership skills through a 360-assessment, one-on-one leadership coaching, and in-class learning.
392b3ce7-df3b-4817-ac98-c21e212cc976.name: Nurse Leader Residency

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and participation in 6 monthly, 2-hour classes
Completion of 360 leadership assessment
Participation in one-on-one leadership coaching

12f45b0f-bcc2-4d58-9a2d-b2187295d7ea.description: Our Enterprise Resource Project (ERP) is a system-wide way to make CHRISTUS Associates’ everyday tasks simpler, more efficient, and located all in one place (a platform called Infor). By doing so, Associates can focus on delivering our mission and elevating quality patient care. Infor training sessions were hosted through a variety of methods that included instructor-led classrooms, live virtual webinars, and one-on-one virtual meetings.
12f45b0f-bcc2-4d58-9a2d-b2187295d7ea.name: Bronze Level - 100+ Infor Trained Classes

badge_template_activities.title: Host 100+ Infor training sessions for CHRISTUS Associates.

c98c9d8a-da06-4d80-bdfd-3d0a2dd0198b.description: Earners of the IM University Training - CompTIA A+ Professional Certification badge by CHRISTUS Health demonstrate knowledge of PC, mobile device hardware, peripherals, and networking. Earners also demonstrate familiarity with installing and configuring operating systems including Windows, iOS, Android, Apple OS X and Linux. Individuals who have completed this IM University course are now qualified to take the CompTIA A+ Certification Exam.
c98c9d8a-da06-4d80-bdfd-3d0a2dd0198b.name: IM University Training - CompTIA A+ Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Completed SkillSoft IM University Certification Preparation Curriculum

03ea67fd-0046-4e47-ac1c-2b28f9a4006e.description: Earners of the IM University Training - Information Security Professional Certification (CISSP) badge by CHRISTUS Health are able to understand and implement information security concepts and industry best practices. Earning this badge assures the individual has the breadth and depth of knowledge necessary to establish holistic security programs. Individuals who have completed this IM University course are now qualified to take CISSP Certification Exam.
03ea67fd-0046-4e47-ac1c-2b28f9a4006e.name: IM University Training - Information Security Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Completed SkillSoft IM University Certification Preparation Curriculum

f32d1d8a-ccbe-432c-9730-8f838eff739a.description: Earners of the IM University Training - Microsoft Excel Professional Certification badge by CHRISTUS Health are able to demonstrate the fundamentals of Excel thanks to their participation in this course. Earners are able to create and manage worksheets, workbooks, cells, ranges, tables, pivot tables, templates, charts, and objects as well as applying formulas and functions. Individuals who have completed this IM University course are now qualified to take the Microsoft Excel Certification Exam.
f32d1d8a-ccbe-432c-9730-8f838eff739a.name: IM University Training - Microsoft Excel Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Excel Learning Community sessions
Complete Microsoft Office Excel 2013: Part 1, Second Edition book
Complete Microsoft OfficeExcel 2013: Part 2 tasks applicable to the Microsoft exam

e6747b3a-7223-4d81-a3ce-105d09bdd394.description: Earners of the IM University Training - Project Management Professional Certification badge by CHRISTUS Health are able to apply their knowledge, skills, tools and techniques to project activities to meet a project's requirements thanks to their participation in this IM University course. Recognized and demanded by organizations worldwide, earning this badge gives professionals an edge in the project management field.
e6747b3a-7223-4d81-a3ce-105d09bdd394.name: IM University Training - Project Management Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Completed SkillSoft IM University Certification Preparation Curriculum

8a36f547-4702-4620-8bfb-05096ff43a99.description: CHRISTUS Leadership and Ethics Academy participants are nominated by their CEOs to prepare for executive leadership. The program guides leaders to: (1) develop a more profound understanding of CHRISTUS’ Mission, Vision, and Values to have a deeper commitment to the ministry; (2) develop increased self-awareness to enhance leadership style; (3) become more effective at executing the strategy of the system; and (4) engage and motivate Associates to maximize results.
8a36f547-4702-4620-8bfb-05096ff43a99.name: Leadership and Ethics Academy (copy)

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and participation in five in-person intensive workshops (10 days total)
Attendance and participation in monthly virtual learning opportunities
Completion of 15 hours of one-on-one executive coaching
Completion of a 360 assessment with feedback from supervisor, peers, and direct reports
Development and accomplishment of goals identified on an individualized Leadership Development Plan
Completion of a cross-functional challenge project to address an organizational need
Study of the book What Got You Here Won’t Get You There by Marshall Goldsmith
Additional reading as assigned

fe4ed7b9-1de4-4102-923f-9628cb995804.description: The CHRISTUS Health Qualified Bilingual Staff (QBS) program is a nationally recognized program that qualifies bilingual Associates to interpret for Limited English Proficient patients and their families. Qualified Associates advance our commitment to provide high quality personalized care through their linguistic gifts. The QBS program is two parts: a linguistic assessment as well as an online or in-person Associate training.
fe4ed7b9-1de4-4102-923f-9628cb995804.name: Qualified Bilingual Staff Program - Level 1 Staff

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and participation in 16 hours of QBS training
Pass a medical terminology linguistic test at a Level 1 (between 60% - 79%)
Complete training and pass assessment prior to April 30, 2022

50100e85-51a9-4cf1-9ff2-ba5ca0d232b0.description: The CHRISTUS Health Qualified Bilingual Staff (QBS) program is a nationally recognized program that qualifies bilingual Associates to interpret for Limited English Proficient patients and their families. Qualified Associates advance our commitment to provide high quality personalized care through their linguistic gifts. The QBS program is two parts: a linguistic assessment as well as an online or in-person Associate training.
50100e85-51a9-4cf1-9ff2-ba5ca0d232b0.name: Qualified Bilingual Staff Program - Level 2 Staff

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and participation in 16 hours of QBS training
Pass a medical terminology linguistic test at a Level 2 (above 80%)
Complete training and pass assessment prior to April 30, 2022

1810bfbd-cb79-4565-a618-bc7b91ec5426.description: The RISE CHRISTUS Mentorship Program is designed to develop and grow talent, working with CHRISTUS Health Associates to achieve their full potential using the knowledge, experience and competencies from a qualified mentor during the one-year program.
1810bfbd-cb79-4565-a618-bc7b91ec5426.name: RISE CHRISTUS Mentorship - Mentee

Attend group sessions: book review, lunch and learn & DiSC session
Complete a Competency Development Plan and Presentation
Attend program kickoff and graduation
Attend touchbase meetings with Talent Development Consultant
